detaileddescription.para: String containing the CVS revision. Read out via reflection!
Constants for toString()
Returns the Gene at the given index (locus) within the Chromosome. The first gene is at index zero and the last gene is at the index equal to the size of this Chromosome - 1.

parameterdescription.para: index of the gene value to be returned

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the set of genes that make up this Chromosome. This method exists primarily for the benefit of GeneticOperators that require the ability to manipulate Chromosomes at a low level.

simplesect.para: an array of the Genes contained within this Chromosome

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the genes for the chromosome.
a_genes
the genes to set for the chromosome
InvalidConfigurationException
in case constraint checker is provided
Klaus Meffert
2.6
Returns the size of this Chromosome (the number of genes it contains). A Chromosome's size is constant and will not change, until setGenes(...) is used.

simplesect.para: number of genes contained within this Chromosome instance

detaileddescription.para: Sets the fitness value of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invokved from anything else (except test cases).

parameterdescription.para: a positive integer representing the fitness of this Chromosome

detaileddescription.para: Sets the fitness value of this Chromosome directly without any constraint checks, conversions or checks. Only use if you know what you do.

parameterdescription.para: a positive integer representing the fitness of this Chromosome

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the fitness value of this Chromosome, as determined by the active fitness function. If a bulk fitness function is in use and has not yet assigned a fitness value to this Chromosome, then -1 is returned.
Attention: should not be called from toString() as the fitness value would be computed if it was initial!

simplesect.para: a positive double value representing the fitness of this Chromosome, or -1 if a bulk fitness function is in use and has not yet assigned a fitness value to this Chromosome
the lastly computed fitness value, or FitnessFunction.NO_FITNESS_VALUE in case no value has been computed yet.

detaileddescription.para: Sets whether this Chromosome has been selected by the natural selector to continue to the next generation or manually (e.g. via an add-method).

parameterdescription.para: true if this Chromosome has been selected, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves whether this Chromosome has been selected by the natural selector to continue to the next generation.

simplesect.para: true if this Chromosome has been selected, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Sets the constraint checker to be used for this gene whenever method setAllele(Object) is called.

parameterdescription.para: the constraint checker to be set

detaileddescription.para: This sets the application-specific data that is attached to this Chromosome. Attaching application-specific data may be useful for some applications when it comes time to evaluate this Chromosome in the fitness function.

parameterdescription.para: the new application-specific data to attach to this Chromosome. Should be an instance of IApplicationData

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the application-specific data that is attached to this Chromosome. Attaching application-specific data may be useful for some applications when it comes time to evaluate this Chromosome in the fitness function. JGAP ignores this data functionally.

simplesect.para: the application-specific data previously attached to this Chromosome, or null if there is no data attached

detaileddescription.para: Invoked when this Chromosome is no longer needed and should perform any necessary cleanup. Note that this method will attempt to release this Chromosome instance to the active ChromosomePool, if any.
Increases the number of evolutionary rounds of chromosome in which it has not been changed by one.
Reset age of chromosome because it has been changed.

parameterdescription.para: set the age of the chromosome, see BestChromosomesSelector for a use-case

simplesect.para: 0: Chromosome newly created in this generation. This means it does not need being crossed over with another newly created one

detaileddescription.para: Increase information of number of genetic operations performed on chromosome in current evolution round.
Resets the information of how many genetic operators have been performed on the chromosome in the current round of evolution.

simplesect.para: number of genetic operations performed on chromosome in current evolution round

detaileddescription.para: Interface for chromosomes. Normally, you would start using BaseChromosome which implements this interface to build your own chromosome classes.
